entry.title: Cardano Development And Research Are ‘Dramatically Speeding Up,’ Says Hoskinson
entry.summary:
Charles Hoskinson, the founder of Cardano, has revealed substantial progress in the development and research of new protocols. Via X, Hoskinson stated: “Ouroboros Peras is one of the best prototyped protocols we have—a literate Agda specification, a CIP, simulations, and a working prototype prior to the final paper being published. Already negotiating implementation SoW.”
Moreover, Hoskinson made public that human resources are now allocated to Ouroboros Leios. “Research and innovation are dramatically speeding up. The team is now moving all resources to Leios, and 6.8 FTEs are already working on rapid innovation,” he remarked.
The mention of “implementation SoW” refers to the negotiation of an Implementation Statement of Work, a formal document that outlines the specific tasks, delive…

entry.title: Ripple Launches New Stablecoin to Accelerate Cross-Border Payments
entry.summary: Ripple launched a stablecoin in partnership with top crypto exchanges and financial institutions to support cross-border payments. Dubbed RLUSD, the new stablecoin promises reliability and a bridge between traditional finance and the decentralized digital economy. According to Ripple, RLUSD will be available to users worldwide through partnerships with exchanges such as Uphold, Bitstamp, and Bitso. The company aims to enhance liquidity and accelerate the adoption of the new asset. Use Cases The introduction of RLUSD comes at a time when businesses and financial institutions are seeking reliable tools for cross-border transactions and asset tokenization, the company mentioned. Ripple's payment network reportedly covers over 90 markets. According to the firm, the broad coverage…

entry.title: Paxos Launches Stablecoin Payments Platform and Instant USD Conversion
entry.summary: Paxos, a blockchain and tokenization infrastructure provider, has launched a new stablecoin payments platform. This platform powers Stripe’s Pay with Crypto product, enabling merchants to accept stablecoin payments more easily. Paxos' infrastructure provides a full solution for onboarding, payins, conversions, and payouts, aimed at accelerating the processes for payments providers. Stablecoin Payments Lower Costs Stablecoin payments offer businesses a global payment method that reduces costs and simplifies money transfers. They provide an alternative to traditional card and wallet payments, often with lower fees and faster processing times. As cross-border digital payments grow, stablecoins are becoming a key player in the payment landscape. “Stablecoins are the future o…

entry.title: BlackRock CEO Fink Unleashes Bitcoin Bombshell In Q3 Earnings Call
entry.summary:
During BlackRock’s third-quarter earnings call, CEO Larry Fink articulated a strong endorsement of Bitcoin and digital assets. Fink’s commentary not only underscored Bitcoin as a standalone asset class but also paralleled its burgeoning significance with historical financial markets like mortgages which are now worth $11 trillion and high-yield bonds.
BlackRock CEO Praises Bitcoin
“We believe Bitcoin is an asset class in itself,” Fink stated unequivocally. “It is an alternative to other commodities like gold.” He also revealed that BlackRock is actively engaging with institutions worldwide regarding digital asset allocation. “Conversations we’re having with institutions worldwide [are] about how they should think about digital assets, what type of asset allocation there should be,” he …

entry.title: Bitcoin Leads As Crypto Fund Inflows Hit $407M—What’s Driving the Surge?
entry.summary:
The cryptocurrency market witnessed a significant influx of investments last week, as notable factors played a key role in shifting investor sentiment.
According to the latest report from CoinShares, digital asset investment products saw $407 million in net inflows globally, marking a sharp recovery after a previous week of outflows. This surge in inflows has been primarily attributed to an interesting trend In the United States.
Bitcoin Leads In Fund Inflows As Ethereum Sees Continued Outflows
Bitcoin investment products were the main leader in last week’s fund flow, attracting $419 million in net inflows, according to data from CoinShares.
Interestingly, short-Bitcoin investment products, designed to profit from Bitcoin’s price declines, saw $6.3 million in outflows, reflecting…

entry.summary: Decrypt Reporters Sander Lutz and Liz Napolitano spoke with Binance CEO Richard Teng about the crypto exchange's progress on establishing a global headquarters, improving its relationships with regulators, and expanding its global presence in the wake of founder Changpeng "CZ" Zhao's jailing in the U.S.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 207 - WELCOME BACK TO THE BULL!
entry.summary: Kamala signals support for crypto. Top memecoins all soar, add $10bn in value in a week. MOODENG hits $180m, does 11x in a week. SUI & SEI continue to lead L1s for price & TVL growth. Revolut & Robinhood are considering stablecoin. Visa launches new tokenisation platform for banks. PayPal to allow business accounts to hold crypto Hamster kombat's HMSTER disappoints on launch. Biden admin may have forced Silvergate’s closure. Court rules crypto mining boxes ‘are securities’.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 206 - MEMES ARE PUMPING!
entry.summary: BTC nears $65k key resistance level. Kamala makes positive comments about crypto. PayPal allows businesses to hold crypto. Visa allows banks to test RWAs & smart contracts. Cuban wants to be head of SEC. Silvergate claims about ‘Chokepoint 2.0’ grow. Truflation hacked for $5m. Telegram Wallet blocked in UK & US. Court rules crypto mining boxes are securities. Infinex DeFi platform raises $65m. Ethena announces new stablecoin linked to BUIDL.
